data.title: Catherine G. (Galant) Doyle Obituary 2020
data.meta_description: Catherine G. Doyle, age 86 of Morrisville, PA, passed away peacefully on Wednesday, April 29, 2020 at Manor Care of Yardley, PA. Born in Altoona, PA, she lived in Abington, PA f...
data.meta_site_name: J. Allen Hooper Funeral Chapel and Cremation Services
data.text:
Catherine G. Doyle, age 86 of Morrisville, PA, passed away peacefully on Wednesday, April 29, 2020 at Manor Care of Yardley, PA. Born in Altoona, PA, she lived in Abington, PA for over 30 years, before moving to Morrisville, PA.

Prior to her retirement, she was employed as a school bus driver with Pennsbury School District for over 30 years. In her younger years, she was a hair stylist and waitressed part-time.

Catherine loved to golf with her late husband Dick and enjoyed going out to dinner and dancing. She was a great dancer! She also liked knitting, crochet, vegetable gardening and planted the most beautiful flower gardens. Her favorite was cooking and entertaining with family and friends for holidays and picnics. After she received her bread machine as a gift, everyone in the family and her neighborhood, including the mailman had homemade bread always! She really loved to shop and had a great sense of style. She also enjoyed sitting outside, doing word search puzzles, and chatting with her neighbors.

She was loving, caring, and generous, and always took the time to make sure her loved ones were taken care of.

Daughter of the late Stanley J. and Edith (Guida) Galant, and wife of the late Richard (Dick) Doyle, she is survived by her loving daughter, Cynthia (Cindy) Beasley and Son-in-Law Hank and her beloved Granddaughter Jade Beasley of Morrisville, PA.

Catherine was the oldest of six siblings. Her three Brothers: William Galant (Nancy) of Ft, Myers, FL, Robert Galant (Joan) of Fort Mill, SC, John Galant (Ruth) of Ft. Myers, FL. Her two Sisters: Helene Valli (Albert) of Robbinsville, NJ, Edith Dager (Dwight) of Morrisville, PA. She had five nieces, three nephews and several great nieces and nephews.

Her services, and interment in Our Lady of Grace Cemetery, Langhorne, will be held privately, entrusted to the care of the J. Allen Hooper Funeral Chapel, Morrisville, PA.
